discussion.content: Option B is correct answer
Exploration: “What else can you tell me about yourself?”

Selected Answer: B
Four Discovery phases:
- Scanning: Are you there? How will I classify you?
o Probes and sensors are used
- Classification: How should I classify you specifically?
o Probes and sensors are used
- Identification: Have I seen you before?
o Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)
- Exploration: What else can you tell me about yourself? 
o Software running on the IP-enabled device is identified
o Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)

Selected Answer: B
a. Scanning: “Are you there? How will I classify you?”
b. Classification: “How should I classify you specifically?”
c. Identification: “Have I seen you before?”:
i. Patterns are used
d. Exploration: “What else can you tell me about yourself?”
i. Patterns are used
I agree - the answer is B as per page 113 from the SN SAM Pro text provided with the course.

Selected Answer: B
exploration add specific information about Serce

questions.question_text: Within ServiceNow Discovery, the Exploration phase determines what?

choices.B: What else can you tell me about yourself?
choices.A: Are you there? How will I classify you?
choices.D: How should I classify you specifically?

choices.C: Run the “Discover software installations” script to copy records from the [cmdb_ci_spkg] table to the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table
choices.A: Convert the records from the [cmdb_ci_spkg] table into the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table
choices.B: Run the “Migrate software installations” script to copy records from the [cmdb_ci_spkg] table to the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table
choices.D: Export the records from the [cmdb_ci_spkg] table into an xml spreadsheet and import them into the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table

questions.question_text: If your organization is currently running Discovery, but has not yet installed the SAM Professional application, what must you do after installing SAM in order to make your discovered software installation information available to SAM?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/t_MigrateSWInstalls.html

Migrate software installations
If you are using Discovery, run this script after installing the Software Asset Management application to copy previously discovered software installation records from the [cmdb_software_instance] table to the [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table, which is used by the Software Asset Management application to store software installation records.

Selected Answer: B
PG. 120, super clear

questions.question_text: When a Software Installation record is created, ServiceNow attempts to match the installation to a:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Its about the ServiceNow Discovery process, so Discovery Software Model

Selected Answer: C
From Software Discovery in SAM Fundamentals:

As part of the discovery process, software installations are matched with a software discovery model using the primary key from the Software Installation [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table. If a software discovery model is not found that matches the primary key, a new software discovery model is automatically created.
Correct ans is C. It is mentioned in Ebook page no 123

I think it's B
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/duplicate-sw-models.html

questions.question_text:
ServiceNow Discovery has 4 phases: Scanning; Classification; Identification; and Exploration.
In which phase is the software running on a device identified?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Exploration is the phase where the software, running on the IP enabled device, is identified.

Selected Answer: C
Four Discovery phases:
- Scanning: Are you there? How will I classify you?
o Probes and sensors are used
- Classification: How should I classify you specifically?
o Probes and sensors are used
- Identification: Have I seen you before?
o Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)
- Exploration: What else can you tell me about yourself? 
o Software running on the IP-enabled device is identified
o Patterns are used (or additional probes and sensors)

Selected Answer: C
Exploration is the phase where the software running on the IP-enabled device is identified.
option c, Exploration
